[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1295961/000143774922001542/qegy20210831b_10qa.htm 1413

CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. [DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 004 - Statement - Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows (Unaudited). CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and CommonStockPayableUnrealizedGain is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1295961/000143774922001542/qegy20210831b_10qa.htm 1413
